Note that most of the notation used here is defined in the entry prime
spectrum.

If $R$ is a commutative ring with identity and $I$ is an ideal of $R$
with $V(I)=\emptyset$, then $I=R$.

Let $R$ be a commutative ring with identity and $I$ be an ideal of $R$
with $I \neq R$. Then, by , there exists a maximal ideal $M$ of $R$
containing $I$. Since $M$ is , then $M$ is a proper prime ideal of $R$.
Thus, $M \in V(I)$. The theorem follows.
